org.lrima.laop.settings

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lrima.laop.settings.Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the settings in different scopes and allows the user to get and set the controls of the different settings. The scope is used to differentiate for example the settings for one algorithm and the others
    Author:
    Clement Bisaillon

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String GLOBAL_SCOPE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Settings()
      Initiates the settings by reseting the scopes and by adding a global scope

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String scope,
                            java.lang.String key)
        Get the value of a setting in a certain scope and represented by a key
        Parameters:
        scope - - The scope to get the setting from. This field is not case-sensitive.
        key - - The key associated with the setting. This field is not case-sensitive.
        Returns:
        an object representing the value stored.

      • set

        public boolean set(java.lang.String scope,
                   java.lang.String key,
                   java.lang.Object value)
        Set the value of a setting in a certain scope and represented by a key. If the scope if non existent, this method creates a new scope.
        Parameters:
        scope - - The scope to get the setting from. This field is not case-sensitive.
        key - - The key associated with the setting. This field is not case-sensitive.
        value - - The value to assign the the setting
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • removeScope

        public boolean removeScope(java.lang.String scope)
        Removes a scope from the settings
        Parameters:
        scope - - the name of the scope. This field is not case-sensitive
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • scopeExist

        public boolean scopeExist(java.lang.String scope)
        Checks if the scope exist
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope to check
        Returns:
        true if the scope exist, false otherwise

      • getScopes

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Scope> getScopes()
        Returns:
        all the scopes

      • getScopeKeys

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getScopeKeys()
        Returns:
        all the scope keys of the settings

      • getLocalScopeKeys

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLocalScopeKeys()
        Get all the scopes except for the global
        Returns:
        the scopes without global

      • getLocalScopes

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Scope> getLocalScopes()
        gets an array of all the local scopes
        Returns:
        an array containing all the local scopes

      • lock

        public LockedSetting lock(java.lang.String scope)
        Creates a lockdowned version of this settings. The returned setting will only be limited to this scope.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope to limit the setting to
        Returns:
        the limited version of the settings.
